channel.title: [637] Echo; Adv. Logs, Dynamic Signatures, Farming, Launcher, and more!
channel.description:
[CENTER][IMG]http://imageshack.us/a/img692/8263/bannerbak.png[/img]
[img]http://cdn4.iconfinder.com/data/icons/Hypic_Icon_Pack_by_shlyapnikova/16/forum_16.png[/img]Website: [url=http://rune-force.org]Echo - Website/Forums[/url] [img]http://cdn2.iconfinder.com/data/icons/splashyIcons/download.png[/img]Download: [url=http://www.mediafire.com/?myi28n555311lsi]Echo Client.zip[/url] [img]http://cdn2.iconfinder.com/data/icons/diagona/icon/16/067.png[/img]Webclient: [url=http://rune-force.org/index.php?/page/play.html]Echo - Echo Webclient[/url]
Current Features:
Lobby now displays whether you have recoveries, membership days, e-mail registered, and messages on the forums Being a 'Donator' is now being a 'Member' with 'Membership days', that decrease with each day passing Echo Launcher Infraction Manager. If you receive an Infraction on the forums, the server will notify you. Infractions can also be applied to in-game offences. Adventure Logs Highscores Clue Scrolls Grand Exchange Skilling Combat
Every skill minus; Construction, Dungeoneering, Hunter, Summoning, and these are currently in development!
[IMG]http://img23.imageshack.us/img23/83/advertm.png[/img]
[/CENTER]

item.title: [637] Echo; Adv. Logs, Dynamic Signatures, Farming, Launcher, and more!
item.dc:creator: @Compiler Compiler
item.description:
@Compiler wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:5, topic:509503”]I like some of the web-sided stuff, could do with some pretty big changes design wise though. The signature font colour is a little hard to read, it’s all crammed together, the font doesn’t really seem like something you’d relate to medieval type things. If you provide some back-end code I can critique that and possibly give some optimization tips. Also, I don’t really think the forums theme is fitting to the type of server. Fair enough, the theme’s alright for villavu considering it’s clean, slick, minimalist but this server is very graphics heavy and so are the signatures and adventure logs etc, just some small changes needing made here and there.

At least you’ve made an effort towards some unique features, good luck.[/quote]

Thank you for the suggestions!

Yeah, I have a hard time fitting themes together, but it’s coming along so far.

It’s our first couple weeks, and I can feel we’ll progress, and suggestions like yours are always appreciated.

Read full topic
item.source: [637] Echo; Adv. Logs, Dynamic Signatures, Farming, Launcher, and more!

item.title: [637] Echo; Adv. Logs, Dynamic Signatures, Farming, Launcher, and more!
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I like some of the web-sided stuff, could do with some pretty big changes design wise though. The signature font colour is a little hard to read, it’s all crammed together, the font doesn’t really seem like something you’d relate to medieval type things. If you provide some back-end code I can critique that and possibly give some optimization tips. Also, I don’t really think the forums theme is fitting to the type of server. Fair enough, the theme’s alright for villavu considering it’s clean, slick, minimalist but this server is very graphics heavy and so are the signatures and adventure logs etc, just some small changes needing made here and there.

At least you’ve made an effort towards some unique features, good luck.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Compiler wrote:

[CENTER]

Website: Echo - Website/Forums
Download: Echo Client.zip
Webclient: Echo - Echo Webclient

Current Features:

Lobby now displays whether you have recoveries, membership days, e-mail registered, and messages on the forums
Being a ‘Donator’ is now being a ‘Member’ with ‘Membership days’, that decrease with each day passing
Echo Launcher
Infraction Manager. If you receive an Infraction on the forums, the server will notify you. Infractions can also be applied to in-game offences.
Adventure Logs
Highscores
Clue Scrolls
Grand Exchange
Skilling
Combat

Every skill minus; Construction, Dungeoneering, Hunter, Summoning, and these are currently in development!

[/CENTER]
